solution.text:
Perimeter of cylinder = Breadth of paper
\(= 2\pi r = _{k}_\)
Therefore, r = _{{trunc((k*Decimal('0.5'))/pi_val, 2)}}_ cm
Volume of a cylinder \(= \pi r^2h = _{{trunc(pi_val*((k*Decimal('0.5')/pi_val)**2)*j, 2)}}_ cm^3\)

content.text: Rajiv likes to make 3D shapes from paper. Yesterday, he started with a rectangular piece of paper of length _{j}_ cm and breadth _{k}_ cm. He then rolled the paper into a cylinder so that the cylinder is now _{j}_ cm long. What is the volume (in \(cm^3\)) of the air inside the cylinder so formed?
